reviewText:
I'm giving this game a 5/10 Some very cool ideas here, and some solid simulation building. The CONCEPT of the story is very cool.

All that said, I am kind of offended as to how little research the developers did into the actual Coast Guard. I was in the Coast Guard. Its nothing like this. This is more like the story of the most well funded, die hard auxilarists the world has ever known.

Also special mention has to be given to the script and voice acting. I think the developers voiced this themselves in their house and had to keep their voice down because the kids were asleep or something. It's Jill Sandwich" bad.

All that said
date: I'm enjoying the game and am impressed with the branching storylines (complete ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t as some of them are) So this gets a tentative thumbs up
recommended: only if it is on sale.\n\nIf someone took this and threw a heapload more time and money towards it
hoursPlayed: we would have an exceptional gem\n\nSemper Paratus"
votesTotal: 62 of 67 people (93%) found this review helpful 6 people found this review funny

reviewText:
This game was awesome, I loved the gameplay and the story.

You have an option of a gun the entire game, I never used one.
I was stuck on two parts for probably an hour each, so not including that, I don't really think 19$ is worth 7hrs of gameplay.

I wish the game was longer and had more to it, thought it was going to be a heavy simulatiton game but it is alot more of an investigation/puzzle game.

Pros: Great idea, great story, fun gameplay
Cons: Short story, don't actually use a gun when its in the manual, glitchy at some points, more of just an investigation game than driving boats

reviewText:
**CAUTION!!: This game is only cautiously recommended" as it scores right on the border!**
---------------------------------------------------------------------

"Coast Guard" is another one of these games that I knew nothing about until I received an email from one of my awesome PR contacts who told me a bit about the game and offered a review code for me to give it a bit of coverage. Of course
date: I don't keep abreast on every latest game
recommended: and so it's normal for some to fall between the cracks
hoursPlayed: but overall sometimes it's a good thing - I like finding surprise gems to try out. Add to this the fact that the game claims to be about the "coast guard
voteText: and I really wanted to give it a go.\n\nRight off the bat I should say that the game really isn't about the Coast Guard as most of us would think about it. From what I can gather after having played a bit of the game, this coast guard" seems more like a civilian auxilliary at best
helpfulPercent: or maybe a privatized maritime security group operating at the behest of some fictional country or another. The flag
votesHelpful: while at first glance appearing to be a U.S. flag
votesTotal: is actually just an orange and black striped flag. And there is other incidental evidence that says they are not a military group. So
votesFunny: this disappointed me a bit.\n\nThis game also isn't a "simulator" of any kind
column16: I'd classify it as a narrative action-adventure
column17: which revolves around Finn Asdair and his crew and cohorts as they venture into the waters to stop smugglers and traffickers. It's really a mixture of different gameplay types. At times
column18: you'll be navigating the waters on a clipper rescuring victims out at sea. Sometimes you'll be delivering someone to a destination or using the boat to board another vessel or location. Other times
column19: you may be putting out fires with the hoses on your main vessel or interrogating a suspect in a maritime criminal operation.\n\nThe story at first is a bit confusing with how it drops you into things
column20: but it starts making sense pretty quickly. Essentially
column22: Finn is trapped aboard a ghost ship" and is trying to figure out why he is there and how he can get off of it. There is some basic exploration and simple puzzle-solving that needs to happen during this phase of the game
column23: but as he discovers interactable clues
column24: the game will send the player into flashbacks that tell the back story of Finn and his operations and how he got to the predicament in the present.\n\nThe game's story is pretty interesting
column25: at least to me. And I definitely find that the game has a pretty good soundtrack. The gameplay itself is decent enough
column26: despite some bugginess and frustrating controls at times (particularly during the rescue mode on the clipper)
column27: but I was able to power through that enough to not totally detract from this game's score.\n\nThe game is good in places
column28: yet flawed in others. The graphics (particularly on the character models) need work in places and the controls can be frustratingly-buggy in the maritime segments. The voice acting is very hit and miss. Some of it sounds like it was recorded during a 2:00 AM Skype call when people needed to try not to wake their family members up
column29: and other parts simply have no emotion behind them. Yet
column30: some of the actors (most likely people on the dev team or their friends/family) did a decent enough job and carried their parts well. It's too bad that Finn himself is so unemotional and boring
column31: though.\n\nI question little things like why the "Director of Coast Guard Operations" would need to be manning a small clipper on his own to rescue victims out at sea
column32: rather than on some large vessel or at an operations center on the mainland. Even if this coast guard is a para-military group that is a privatized security company
column33: someone of that level/rank would not need to be out in the field.\n\nYet
column35: Coast Guard does deliver in its mission to tell a good narrative story. It presents some interesting gameplay features (I like the different modes of play during your maritime operations
column38: even if some of the execution is very poor or extremely flawed in places. It's ultimately the story
column40: and the soundtrack that save this game and give it the score I'm giving it.\n\nIt's borderline
column42: so beware...Whether this one is worth getting or not depends on your personal tastes. Me? I'd only pick it up if you get it during a good Steam sale or as part of a bundle.\n\nOn a scale of 0 to 10

reviewText:
Around an hour I spent on the first mission, the ghost ship. No denying I enjoyed the majority of it. The game has real potential, and the different elements mixed together do work very well - sure, the first person sequences are rough and require work, and there's bugs galore, but there's the essence of a great game in here.

Unfortunately the simple lack of a basic save system meaning you pretty much lose everything once you stop playing unless you're lucky enough that you passed a (unidentifiable) checkpoint means the game is basically alpha and not fit for public release.

Doors which don't actually work properly, to interface elements which simple haven't been playtested properly, this is a game in early development which has evidently been released in borderline alpha state.

Shame really, it really is a good game underneath the hood, but unfortunately it's rather broken and stops you enjoying it as much as you'd want to.

Polish it more and this is a definite yes, but as it stands it's just too rough to justify the cost - if it had been early access I'd have been infinitely more forgiving.

Come back when you've done more work on the game, fellas.

reviewText: I've been playing the game for more than 3 hours now and I have to say that this isn't the typical simulation game. Although it features what you'd expect from a simulation (how the ships are controlled, rescuing people etc.), it is driven by a great story.

This looks, sounds, and plays like a student project attached to a Unity water physics tech demo.

Full review:
http://www.darkstation.com/reviews/coast-guard/
A very short campaign,if your looking to get into a hooked,long,simulator then don't buy this.The Coast Guard operates no where near what this game makes it seem like.
